Benjee has been busy lately with some real life work. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)") I don't forsee anything being added to the pack but hopefully it continues to work.

> 3 hours ago, sp1989 said:
> 
> 
> I've been using it seems like it's all good. Beautiful parts and super useful for colony building.
> 

Depending on your preferences, there were/are some patches posted up the thread, circa nov 20 for adjusting the ratios used for these tanks c.f. other hydrogen using mods.

They are nice tanks though!

I have added some interstage nodes (with accompanying truss) to the DIRECT fairings, with the help of [@IronCretin](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/158162-ironcretin/)'s [fairing node calculator](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/149630-fairing-interstage-node-calculator/). 

The combined maintenance patches I've provided can be found [here](https://github.com/LouisB3/LB_KSP_Configs/blob/master/ModTweaks/DIRECT_Rebalance.cfg), with a Community Tech Tree support patch [here](https://github.com/LouisB3/LB_KSP_Configs/blob/master/CTTSupport/DIRECT_CTT.cfg).

EDIT: Combined patches and moved to [here](https://github.com/LouisB3/LB_KSP_Configs/blob/master/ModTweaks/DIRECT_Support.cfg)

**Edited <time datetime="2017-04-15T01:23:42Z" title="04/15/2017 01:23  AM" data-short="7 yr">April 15, 2017</time> by PocketBrotector**

> 
> 
> 20 minutes ago, PocketBrotector said:
> 
> 
> I have added some interstage nodes (with accompanying truss) to the DIRECT fairings, with the help of [@IronCretin](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/158162-ironcretin/)'s [fairing node calculator](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/149630-fairing-interstage-node-calculator/). 
> 
> 
> 
> 
> The combined maintenance patches I've provided can be found [here](https://github.com/LouisB3/LB_KSP_Configs/blob/master/ModTweaks/DIRECT_Rebalance.cfg), with a Community Tech Tree support patch [here](https://github.com/LouisB3/LB_KSP_Configs/blob/master/CTTSupport/DIRECT_CTT.cfg).
> 

As I haven't looked back into the thread - are these updates on the existing patches or add on to them?

> 
> 
> On 4/10/2017 at 5:06 PM, rasta013 said:
> 
> 
> As I haven't looked back into the thread - are these updates on the existing patches or add on to them?
> 

It's the combined and updated version of everything I've provided to date (and looking back, I think I'm the only one who's been providing patches). So if you just have DIRECT itself and [this](https://github.com/LouisB3/LB_KSP_Configs/blob/master/ModTweaks/DIRECT_Rebalance.cfg), you'll have everything I have. If you want to use LH2, you'll want CryoEngines; and if you have CTT, you'll want the DIRECT\_CTT patch I linked to above.

EDIT: combined all support patches and moved them to [here](https://github.com/LouisB3/LB_KSP_Configs/blob/master/ModTweaks/DIRECT_Support.cfg)

**Edited <time datetime="2017-04-15T01:24:24Z" title="04/15/2017 01:24  AM" data-short="7 yr">April 15, 2017</time> by PocketBrotector**

Cool man thanks - saved me a bunch of time digging back through to try and remember who posted when and where. ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif ":P") 'preciate the work!

Jupiter V!

Spoiler

![jzhtGRj.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/jzhtGRj.jpg)

Boasting 31 LH2O-fed SSMEs and 8 five-segment SRBs, it can lift 1000 tons to orbit. (A Jupiter III with 19 SSMEs and 4 SRBs can move a comparatively paltry 600 tons to <abbr title="Low Kerbin Orbit">LKO</abbr>.)

Also, a Korolev cross made of shuttle EFTs is pretty neat...

Spoiler

![JFn2DFg.jpg](http://imgur.com/JFn2DFg.jpg)

**Edited <time datetime="2017-05-05T03:48:46Z" title="05/05/2017 03:48  AM" data-short="7 yr">May 5, 2017</time> by PocketBrotector**

>

> I actually came here to post a question about the ratios on the B-Series tanks, since it was way off the usual LH2/Ox norm. Turns out it's actually <abbr title="Liquid Fuel">LF</abbr>/Ox. Funny that. ![:rolleyes:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_rolleyes.gif ":rolleyes:")
> 
> 
> 
> As an aside, does anyone know of a good IVA for the Orion? All the ones I've tried don't match that well.
> 

Are you referring to this pod?

 ![aFzHw06.png?1](http://i.imgur.com/aFzHw06.png?1)

Because I know an IVA mod that seems to work just great for this pod! ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")

> 
> 
> 1 hour ago, ISE said:
> 
> 
> Because I know an IVA mod that seems to work just great for this pod!
> 

Don't be coy

> 
> 
> 14 hours ago, PocketBrotector said:
> 
> 
> Don't be coy
> 

[MK1-2 IVA Replacement by ASET](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/116440-mk1-2-pod-iva-replacement-by-aset/)  seemed to work just fine with this pod as well as the Mk1-2 Pod, I only got a glimpse, but I didn't see anything wrong when I tried it out for this pod. The IVA replacement is available on <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr> as well, I recommend installing it that way if you aren't all that familiar with installing.

> 
> 
> 9 minutes ago, ISE said:
> 
> 
> [MK1-2 IVA Replacement by ASET](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/116440-mk1-2-pod-iva-replacement-by-aset/)  seemed to work just fine with this pod as well as the Mk1-2 Pod, I only got a glimpse, but I didn't see anything wrong when I tried it out for this pod. The IVA replacement is available on <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr> as well, I recommend installing it that way if you aren't all that familiar with installing.
> 

Oh... well, yeah, the DIRECT Orion uses the stock Mk1-2 IVA as a placeholder, so anything that replaces the Mk1-2 IVA will affect the Orion.

But the windows will still be in the wrong place & too small, not to mention that the Mk1-2 only has three seats while the Orion has six...

> 
> 
> 1 minute ago, PocketBrotector said:
> 
> 
> Oh... well, yeah, the DIRECT Orion uses the stock Mk1-2 IVA as a placeholder, so anything that replaces the Mk1-2 IVA will affect the Orion.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> But the windows will still be in the wrong place & too small, not to mention that the Mk1-2 only has three seats while the Orion has six...
> 

I did not think of that..... what if you were to go into the cfgs for the prion pod and change it to only have 3 seats? and for the windows hmmm I see your point.
I'm guessing the previously mentioned real life work hasn't stopped?
Is there a stock size version of this mod?

As far as I know it is Stock Size. The Direct-Launchers are very big.  

But you can edit them easily: Change the rescaleFactor in every cfg.
